Name: Cow
Description: Cows can sleep while they're standing. Now, that's a skill everyone wants!

Name: Elephant
Description: These massive animals can't jump, nor can they run for very long!

Name: Lion
Description: It's the female lions that hunt for food. Male lions protect their home and cubs.

Name: Rhinoceros
Description: Did you know that a group of rhinos is called a crash? Can you guess why?

Name: Camel
Description: Camels like being friends with other camels and live in large groups!

Name: Kangaroo
Description: Kangaroos are only found in Australia and their babies are called Joeys!

Name: Ape
Description: Gorillas, chimpanzees, orangutans, bonobos, and gibbons are all different types of apes.

Name: Hippopotamus
Description: Hippos only eat plants and like looking for food at night!

Name: Snake
Description: Snakes don't have eyelids! So, they don't blink and sleep with their eyes open.

Name: Lizards
Description: Most lizards know how to swim. Some can even run on water!

Name: Tortoise
Description: Tortoises have very long lives. Some can live upto a 100 years!

Name: Crocodile
Description: Crocodiles don't sweat. To stay cool, they keep their mouths open.

Name: Chameleon
Description: The smallest chameleon is almost as big as your eraser.

Name: Anaconda
Description: Anacondas are the largest snakes in the world! They can grow up to almost 9 meters long!

Name: Iguana
Description: Iguanas can talk to each other by bobbing their heads! How cool is that!

Name: Gecko
Description: Geckos come in different sizes, but the smallest one can fit on a dime.

Name: Tyrannosaurus Rex (T-Rex)
Description: This dinosaur had the strongest bite of any animal on Earth, ever!

Name: Velociraptor
Description: This dinosaur had the biggest brain of all the dinosaurs, literally!

Name: Stegosaurus
Description: This dinosaur was given the name Roofed Lizard because of its spiky back!

Name: Triceratops
Description: This dinosaur had the biggest head of all land animals!

Name: Allosaurus
Description: This dinosaur was given the name Different Lizard because of its funky backbone!

Name: Ankylosaurus
Description: This massive dinosaur had very tiny teeth! Isn't that amazing?

Name: Pterodactyl
Description: These dinosaurs were the largest flying animals that ever lived.

Name: Diplodocus
Description: These were the longest dinosaurs that ever lived. That's longer than four buses in row.

Name: Seahorse
Description: Worried about stomach pain? A seahorse doesn't even have one! It eats non-stop to stay alive.

Name: Shark
Description: You might trip in darkness but a shark won't! They have excellent night vision.

Name: Dolphin
Description: A dolphin lives in water but never drinks any! It gets water from the food it eats.

Name: Whale
Description: Whales sing all day long! They hold the record for singing the longest songs on repeat.

Name: Crab
Description: Crabs not only walk but also swim sideways! Run forward and it can never catch you!

Name: Octopus
Description: We might die if our heart stops but an octopus won't! It lives with three hearts.

Name: Stingray
Description: A stingray doesn't have the teeth quite like a shark but they are cousins!

Name: Turtle
Description: Turtles have been around for over 200 million years! Let's show them some respect!

Name: Butterfly
Description: Butterflies taste with their feet! Every time they land on a flower, they are tasting it!

Name: Bee
Description: Bees have a strong sense of smell and can see all the colors except red.

Name: Ladybug
Description: Ladybugs are not actually bugs! They are a type of beetle!

Name: Grasshopper
Description: Grasshoppers have been on earth for a long time! They were here even before the dinosaurs!

Name: Firefly
Description: If you catch a firefly in a jar, be sure to let it go after a day, or it will die!

Name: Caterpillar
Description: A caterpillar is what turns into a big beautiful butterfly!

Name: Mantis
Description: A mantis has two eyes, that too at the bottom of their belly!

Name: Beetle
Description: Beetles can camp in hot deserts as well as the polar regions! Talk about being adaptable!

Name: Spaceship
Description: There are actual spaceships used by humans! These are called space shuttles!

Name: An Alien
Description: An alien is a creature from another planet! We don't really know if they exist!

Name: The Sun
Description: The sun is actually a star! And it is the closest star to our planet, Earth!

Name: The Moon
Description: The moon has no light of its own. It shines because of the sun's light!

Name: Shooting Stars
Description: Shooting stars are not actually stars! They are rocks from outer space!

Name: Satellite
Description: Satellites are like robot spies. They are sent to outer space to collect information!

Name: Unknown Flying Object (UFO)
Description: UFOs are things in the sky that cannot be explained by the people who see them!

Name: Telescope
Description: A telescope lets us see things that are very very far! Like the moon!

Name: Helicopter
Description: This aircraft can take off and land straight-up. It can move in all directions.

Name: Ship
Description: You thought you swim well? This watercraft can float on oceans and deep waters.

Name: Airplane
Description: An airplane can fly and helps us get from one city to the other. It is heavier than air.

Name: Submarine
Description: This watercraft can stay in deep waters for months. It is also used in wars.

Name: Taxi
Description: It is a car with a driver that can take you to a place of your choice.

Name: Hot Air Balloon
Description: This fun aircraft is lighter than air. The bag inside it is called an envelope.

Name: Tractor
Description: You find this on a farm. The fastest tractor can travel at a speed of more than 60 mph.

Name: Truck
Description: If all the U.S. trucks were arranged in a line, they will end at the Moon.

Name: Sunflower
Description: Each sunflower contains thousands of tiny sunflowers.

Name: Rose
Description: The oldest rose alive is 1,000 years old and lives in Germany.

Name: Marigold
Description: You can munch on a tasty marigold in your salad and dessert.

Name: Lotus
Description: It keeps the lake water cool and saves fish from direct sunlight too.

Name: Lily
Description: Lilies love to have a social life. They grow together in groups of three to five.

Name: Jasmine
Description: This special flower lets its fragrance out at night after the sun sets.

Name: Tulip
Description: You can munch on a tulip! It is edible and used for making wine.

Name: Daisy
Description: Daisies are more than 4,000 years old. Their stalks are longer than their leaves.

Name: Mushroom
Description: These umbrella-like things are not the whole plant. Most of it actually grows underground!

Name: Pumpkin
Description: We can eat every part of a pumpkin plant, even its seeds and stem!

Name: Bell Pepper
Description: All three types of bell peppers start as green and turn yellow and then red as they ripen!

Name: Cucumber
Description: Raw cucumbers are mostly just water! So grab one next time you feel thirsty!

Name: Onion
Description: The part of the onion we usually eat actually grows underground!

Name: Broccoli
Description: The heaviest broccoli in the world weighed 35 pounds! That's almost as heavy as you!

Name: Peas
Description: Peas are mostly green. But there are also peas that can be yellow or purple!

Name: Turnip
Description: Turnips were the original jack-o'-lantern, like the pumpkins you carve on halloween!

Name: Strawberry
Description: It is the only fruit that grows around 200 seeds on the outside.

Name: Banana
Description: While a single banana is called a finger, a bunch of bananas is called a hand!

Name: Cherries
Description: All cherries growing on a single tree can be picked within seven seconds!

Name: Orange
Description: All oranges are not orange in color. Some of them may be green too!

Name: Pineapple
Description: A pineapple plant can bear only one fruit at a time.

Name: Pear
Description: Pears grow on trees but they ripen best only when they are taken off of them.

Name: Kiwi
Description: It shares its looks and name with the furry brown National bird of New Zealand.

Name: Lemon
Description: A lemon starts off as a small flower with a light fragrance before it turns into a fruit.

Name: Burger
Description: The first ever burger was sold for just 5 cents in 1921.

Name: Pizza
Description: Almost 350 slices of pizza are eaten in the U.S. every second.

Name: Ice cream
Description: An ice cream can give you a brain freeze when the roof of your mouth turns too cold!

Name: Hot Dog
Description: It has been to space! Astronauts on the Apollo 7 mission loved to munch on it.

Name: Cupcake
Description: It is known as 'Fairy cake' in Britain and 'Patty cake' in Australia.

Name: Donut
Description: It was the favorite late night snack of the U.S. police officers in the 1950s.

Name: Cheese
Description: Do you like cheese? It was discovered by mistake by someone around 7000 years ago.

Name: Sushi
Description: You thought it was all about a fish but it's named after vinegar flavored rice!

Name: Christmas
Description: Rudolph is just one of the nine reindeers that pull Santa's sleigh!

Name: Easter
Description: We consume the second highest number of Easter candies on this holiday.

Name: Halloween
Description: Long ago, people wore masks and costumes not for fun but to scare away ghosts!

Name: Birthday
Description: The ancient Greeks made the first ever birthday cake to make their gods happy!

Name: 4th of July
Description: Over one hundred and fifty million hot dogs are consumed all across America today!

Name: St. Patrick's Day
Description: Chicago celebrated this holiday by literally coloring their river green in 1962.

Name: summer holiday
Description: Who doesn't love the summer holidays? It's a time to have fun and go on long vacations.

Name: Snow Day
Description: Ever tried catching a snowflake? You will never find two that look exactly the same!

Name: School
Description: Want to learn, play, and make new friends? A school is the best place to do so.

Name: Bank
Description: When we want to save or borrow money, where should we go? To a bank, of course!

Name: Hospital
Description: Hurt or feeling sick? Rush to a hospital! A doctor or nurse will take care of you.

Name: Church
Description: Christians go to Church. It's a building with the symbol of a cross.

Name: Bakery
Description: Want some delicious bread, cakes, or cookies? Head to a bakery (now)!

Name: Pharmacy
Description: After seeing a doctor, we go to a pharmacy to get the medicines to make us feel better.

Name: Post office
Description: When we want to send letters or postcards we drop by a post office.

Name: Barber Shop
Description: Fancy a haircut? Time to head to a barber shop to get your hair done.

Name: Rainy Day
Description: On a rainy day, don't forget to wear gumboots, raincoats, and carry colorful umbrellas.

Name: Autumn/ Fall
Description: Leaves change color and fall off the trees in the autumn.

Name: Spring
Description: During spring, the weather is generally warm and sunny and flowers begin to bloom!

Name: Winter
Description: Wintertime is the coldest time of the year! It's the perfect time to build a snowman.

Name: Summer
Description: Summer is the year's hottest season! It's clearly the best time for having ice pops.

Name: Beach
Description: It's a great spot for surfing or simply lying in the sun.

Name: Circus
Description: If you enjoy watching clowns and juggling acts, head to a circus!

Name: Jungle
Description: Jungles cover only 6% of the Earth's surface, but they are home to half of all species!

Name: Statue of Liberty
Description: Located in the New York City, this large statue represents the Roman goddess Libertas.

Name: Liberty Bell
Description: This monument is located in Philadelphia. It is a famous symbol of American independence.

Name: Mount Rushmore
Description: It is located in the Black Hills in Keystone and is carved into the side of a mountain.

Name: Eiffel Tower
Description: Designed by Alexandre-Gustave Eiffel, the Eiffel Tower is the tallest structure in Paris.

Name: Colosseum
Description: The Colosseum is an oval-shaped open stadium in Rome. It was built a long long time ago!

Name: London Bridge
Description: The London Bridge is one of the oldest known bridges across the river Thames in London.

Name: Taj Mahal
Description: The Taj Mahal, located in Agra, was built to honor the favorite wife of Shah Jahan.

Name: The Great Pyramid of Giza
Description: The pyramids of Giza in Egypt have shrunk! They are now 455 feet tall.

Name: Doctor
Description: A doctor is someone who treats illnesses and injuries.

Name: Astronaut
Description: An astronaut is a person who travels into outer space.

Name: Firefighter
Description: A firefighter is someone who puts out fires and rescues people.

Name: Chef
Description: A chef is someone who cooks food for a living and manages a kitchen staff.

Name: Teacher
Description: A teacher is someone whose job is to teach and help others gain knowledge.

Name: Police Officer
Description: Police officers are those that work for the police. They solve crimes and protect us.

Name: Mailman
Description: A mailman's job is to collect and deliver letters and packages.

Name: Farmer
Description: A farmer is a person who owns and works on a farm.

Name: Rooster
Description: A rooster protects his flock and warns other birds if he sees danger. Super protective!

Name: Flamingo
Description: Flamingos eat upside-down. Their curved bill helps to filter food from mud and water.

Name: Parrot
Description: Parrots are intelligent birds. They can copy different sounds, including yours!

Name: Peacock
Description: The head of a peacock is covered with feathers, giving it a crown-like look.

Name: Owl
Description: There are about 200 species of owls in the world, with the Elf owl being the tiniest.

Name: Cockatiel
Description: Cockatiel, commonly known as weiro bird or quarrion, is a little parrot.

Name: Hummingbird
Description: Hummingbirds are the smallest of all living birds. They can even fly backwards!

Name: Blue Jay
Description: Blue Jays can copy the sound of hawks. You heard that right!

Name: Plate
Description: Food is served to us on a plate. There are many kinds and shapes. Do you have a favorite one?

Name: Fork
Description: Spain and Italy were the first countries to use forks for eating.

Name: Spoon
Description: We use spoons to eat food. They were used in the past to show status and power.

Name: Knife
Description: The knife is without a doubt the earliest eating tool ever made!

Name: Glass
Description: Glass can be recycled endlessly without losing its quality.

Name: Water Bottle
Description: Making a plastic bottle uses twice as much water as fits inside the bottle!

Name: Kettle
Description: The first electric kettle was invented in the United States in 1891.

Name: Toaster
Description: El Tosto or Eclipse Toaster was the name given to the first toaster.

Name: Book
Description: The term bibliosma refers to the love for the smell of books. Don't new books smell amazing?!

Name: Umbrella
Description: The first waterproof umbrellas were made more than 3000 years ago in ancient China.

Name: Ball
Description: A baseball is a ball used in the sport of the same name, baseball.

Name: Balloon
Description: Do you know  the sport or pastime of flying in a balloon is called ballooning?

Name: Chair
Description: Before chairs were invented, people used to sit on stools or stones. Yikes!

Name: Lamp
Description: Do you know that before electric lamps were invented, oil lamps or candles were used?

Name: Pencil
Description: Enjoy writing with pencils? A pencil can write under water, upside down, and in space.

Name: Keys
Description: The first key was discovered 6000 years ago, about the same time as locks.

Name: Guitar
Description: The world's biggest guitar is 43 feet long! That is longer than your school bus!

Name: Violin
Description: The violin has a nickname! It is also called a fiddle!

Name: Drums
Description: Did you know that drums were used for communicating over long distances?!

Name: Piano
Description: The piano, as we know it, was invented more than 300 years ago!

Name: Flute
Description: Flutes have been around for a long while, and they can be made with wood or metal!

Name: Maracas
Description: Maracas are also called rumba-shakers and chac-chacs because of the sound they make!

Name: Xylophone
Description: That's not an X! Xylophone is pronounced with a Z sound, like this: zai-luh-fone!

Name: Trumpet
Description: Trumpets can get very very loud. Sometimes they can be even louder than a jet plane!
